glsa.title: glibc: Information leak with LD_DEBUG
glsa.synopsis: glibc contains an information leak vulnerability allowing the debugging of SUID binaries.

package.name: sys-libs/glibc
package.arch: alpha arm hppa ia64 sparc s390

background.p: The GNU C library defines various Unix-like "system calls" and other basic facilities needed for a standard POSIX-like application to operate.

description.p: Silvio Cesare discovered a potential information leak in glibc. It allows LD_DEBUG on SUID binaries where it should not be allowed. This has various security implications, which may be used to gain confidentional information.

impact.p: An attacker can gain the list of symbols a SUID application uses and their locations and can then use a trojaned library taking precendence over those symbols to gain information or perform further exploitation.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are encouraged to upgrade to the latest available version of glibc.

resolution.p: All glibc users should upgrade to the latest version:
resolution.code:
# emerge sync
# emerge -pv your_version # emerge your_version
